title.narrative: Planning and monitoring funds for the Finnish Syria-support

description.narrative: The conflict in Syria has just entered its fifth year and it has become the greatest humanitarian catastrophe of our time. The massive demands for resilience reconstruction and humanitarian funding are not going to diminish during 2015.The Finnish developm ent cooperation / resilience funding for the Syrian conflict has risen to above 10 million euros during 2014 (compared to 3 million in 2013). The support is divided into three categories: 1) support for the resilience of the neighboring countries (main foc us in Lebanon), 2) preparing for the reconstruction, and 3) peace building. The support is channeled mainly through UN-agencies World Bank Syrian Recovery Trust Fund and a number of NGOs. The approved Finnish funding for the crisis is 5 MEUR in 2015 and th ere are and agreements can be made for the 2016-2019 worth 41 MEUR.Planning monitoring and assessing the projects are an ongoing process in project management. In practice the Finnish support program was put up during the 2014 and on year 2015 the monitori ng for theses and continuing the planning of the new interventions and next phases of the existing ones will require planning funds during the years 2015-2016. Most of this work is carried out by the MFA and Embassies' staff but additional resources may be acquired through contracting assignments.Most of all the Syrian conflict is unpredictable and the situation on the ground may change drastically even fast. Thus it's very important that sufficient funds are provided for the planning and monitoring so that these changes can be addressed and adapated to.
